title: Lesson 8
paragraph: This lesson examines emotion and disposition, exploring moods, temperament, and emotional tendencies.

words.example: She was a fervent supporter of environmental causes.
He remained impassive despite the chaos around him.

words.japaneseMeaning: 憂うつな、メランコリックな
words.example: The rainy weather made her feel melancholic.

words.meaning: having or showing a feeling of vague longing or regret
words.japaneseMeaning: 物思いにふける、切ない
words.example: He gave a wistful glance at his childhood home.
The audience was rhapsodic after the performance.

words.meaning: enduring pain or hardship without showing feelings
words.japaneseMeaning: ストイックな、無感情な
words.example: He remained stoic despite the criticism.
The irascible manager often shouted at employees.
The placid lake reflected the mountains perfectly.

words.meaning: full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness
words.japaneseMeaning: 元気いっぱいの、あふれる
words.example: The children were exuberant during the festival.

words.meaning: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage
words.japaneseMeaning: 落胆した、意気消沈した
words.example: He felt despondent after failing the exam.
